title.narrative: South Africa Internal Political Party Regulation and Disclosure
South Africa Internal Political Party Regulation and Disclosure

description.narrative: South Africa's electoral system is based on proportional representation, as opposed to first-past-the-post or constituency-based representation. Political parties compile lists of candidates and rank them for purposes of periodic elections. This gives political parties extensive control over both electoral candidates and elected representatives. This grant will allow the Institute for Democracy in South Africa (IDASA) to analyze the practices of South African political parties with respect to disclosure and regulation of financial interests with a view to identifying specific weaknesses and solutions. Project outcomes will include a guide and platform from which to promote best practices before the 2009 general election. The guide will also be used and promoted elsewhere on the continent.
